Question
========
Which statement about R<sup>2</sup> is correct?

Answerlist
----------
* The R<sup>2</sup> is always the same as the standardized regression coefficient ("Beta" in SPSS).
* The R<sup>2</sup> is always the same as the correlation coefficient (*r*) for a simple regression.
* You can always calculate the multiple correlation coefficient (*multiple correlation*) by taking the root of R<sup>2</sup>.
* You can always calculate the R<sup>2</sup> by taking the square of the standardized regression coefficient ("Beta" in SPSS).

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* False
* False
* True
* False
